recipeDescriptionLines.recipeDescriptionLine: Dahi vada is known as dahi bhalla is a popular Indian snack and is prepared by soaking vada in thick yogurt.

White urad dal is soaked overnight and made into a fine paste and then fried for making vadas. Dahi or yogurt is flavored with different spices and chutneys and can be made sweet or salty. This recipe is a sweeter version of dahi vada.
Even though the vadas are deep fried, the excess oil is removed by soaking it in water. This dish is rich in protein and vitamins.

procedureSteps.stepDescription: Wash urad dal and soak for 6 hours in water. Make a smooth paste with 1/2 cup water. The batter should be thick enough to stick to the spoon. Adding too much water will flatten the vadas while frying. Mix it well with salt and let it rest for 10 mins.
For deep frying, take little batter on a tbsp and drop it slowly in the oil that has been heating on a medium flame. Fry the vadas till they are golden brown and pat dry to remove excess oil.
Soak the fried vadas in water for no more than a minute. Squeeze gently to release water from vadas and keep it aside.

Whisk yogurt to remove the lumps. The order in which to mix the spices and chutney is your choice. One way would be to first mix rock salt and sugar then dip the vadas and finish by garnishing with chat masala, cumin powder and sweet tamarind chutney. Another way is to mix all the ingredients together in yogurt followed by adding vadas. I prefer the first way as it looks more presentable.

tips.tipDesc: Letting vadas rest in water too long time will make it very soft.
Green chutney can be used for garnish as well. Please use the search box on top right corner of the page for the green and sweet tamarind chutney recipe.
